alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:29AM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Erie county. Mainly near and north of a line from Platea to Findley Lake. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 AM this morning to 7 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to noon EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A very tight snowfall gradient is expected across northern Erie County mainly near and north of I-90. The heaviest snow likely occurs north of a line from Harborcreek to Findley Lake including the town of North East. There is still forecast uncertainty on how far inland the band of lake effect snow will extend downwind of Lake Erie.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
